alert.note: Alert for Hernando; Pasco; Sumter (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 12 at 3:28AM EDT until October 12 at 9:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 AM EDT FOR CENTRAL SUMTER...NORTHERN PASCO AND SOUTHEASTERN HERNANDO COUNTIES... At 328 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Hill n Dale, or 8 miles northwest of Dade City, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Sumter, northern Pasco and southeastern Hernando Counties, including the following locations... Ridge Manor, Spring Lake, Tarrytown, Croom, Lacoochee, and Blanton. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
